metadata.title: CVE-2021-39164 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Matrix is an ecosystem for open federated Instant Messaging and Voice overIP. In versions 1.41.0 and prior, unauthorised users can access themembership (list of members, with their display names) of a room if theyknow the ID of the room. The vulnerability is limited to rooms with`shared` history visibility. Furthermore, the unauthorised user must beusing an account on a vulnerable homeserver that is in the room. Serveradministrators should upgrade to 1.41.1 or later in order to receive thepatch. One workaround is available. Administrators of servers that use areverse proxy could, with potentially unacceptable loss of functionality,block the endpoints: `/_matrix/client/r0/rooms/{room_id}/members` with `at`query parameter, and `/_matrix/client/unstable/rooms/{room_id}/members`with `at` query parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

matrix-synapse - 1.64.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: matrix-synapse package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.64.0-3').
